name: core_arch::x86::avx::_mm256_maskload_ps

intrinsics::simd::simd_shr.doc:
Shifts vector right elementwise, with UB on overflow.

 `T` must be a vector of integers.

 Shifts `lhs` right by `rhs`, shifting in sign bits for signed types.

 # Safety

 Each element of `rhs` must be less than `<int>::BITS`.

core_arch::x86::avx::_mm256_setzero_ps.doc:
Returns vector of type __m256 with all elements set to zero.

 [Intel's documentation](https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/docs/intrinsics-guide/index.html#text=_mm256_setzero_ps)

intrinsics::simd::simd_masked_load.doc:
Reads a vector of pointers.

 `T` must be a vector.

 `U` must be a pointer to the element type of `T`

 `V` must be a vector of integers with the same length as `T` (but any element size).

 For each element, if the corresponding value in `mask` is `!0`, read the corresponding
 pointer offset from `ptr`.
 The first element is loaded from `ptr`, the second from `ptr.wrapping_offset(1)` and so on.
 Otherwise if the corresponding value in `mask` is `0`, return the corresponding value from
 `val`.

 # Safety
 `ptr` must be aligned according to the `ALIGN` parameter, see [`SimdAlign`] for details.

 `mask` must only contain `0` or `!0` values.

doc:
Loads packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory
 into result using `mask` (elements are zeroed out when the high bit of the
 corresponding element is not set).

 [Intel's documentation](https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/docs/intrinsics-guide/index.html#text=_mm256_maskload_ps)
